humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that 'All ten examined lymph nodes demonstrate metastases.' This information, combined with the new rule 13, which states that N3 indicates metastases in 4 or more axillary lymph nodes, supports the prediction of N3 as the N stage for this patient's cancer.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that all ten examined lymph nodes demonstrate metastases. This corresponds to a pathologic N stage of N3, as defined by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system for breast cancer. The N stage is assigned based on the number of lymph nodes involved, and in this case, the patient has metastases in 10 out of 10 examined lymph nodes. This is a strong indicator of advanced disease and a higher risk of recurrence.
